feedbackList.feedback: I like the organization, how we try to find an application for everything. What I did not like was the heavy parts of neuroscience for non-medical backgrounds.
I like everything in the course.

I liked literally everything, and I didn't dislike one thing :D. I felt that there is more care about all subjects except neuroscience. I put in effort to tackle it, and I think it's okay now, but in comparison to the other subjects, I felt that there was more care about the other subjects.
They are all wonderful.
Ø§Ù„Ù„ÙŠ Ø¹Ø¬Ø¨Ù†ÙŠ. ØªØ±ØªÙŠØ¨ ÙˆØªØ³Ù„Ø³Ù„ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ø¹Ù„ÙˆÙ…Ø§Øª.
Ø§Ù„Ù„ÙŠ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ¹Ø¬Ø¨Ù†ÙŠ Ø£Ø­ÙŠØ§Ù†Ø§Ù‹ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø³Ø¦Ù„Ø© ØºÙŠØ± ÙˆØ§Ø¶Ø­Ø© ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„ØªÙˆØªÙˆØ±ÙŠØ§Ù„.
All things are great.
- I just think the 'neuroscience' content was a little large for two days. Honestly, I had to watch the video 3 times to get enough intuition about what you are saying here.
- I liked the structure of the course, and that everything was so clear before we even started.
- The tutorials were so brilliant. I loved every part of them.
- TA's && Instructors were so helpful for real.

- The variety and different perspectives in the same group made the course really fun. We were shouting out our thoughts like yeah I saw these spikes in biology they are blah blah blah and yeah I also saw this in control theory this means... and yeah yeah this RC circuit it's a low pass filter that's why the graph looks like this.. It made the whole experience so awesome for real.
I liked the diverse backgrounds in the students which helped us learn more from each other's experience. Also, I liked meeting professionals in this field and discussing things together.
I disliked that we didn't delve much into neuroscience; it was more focused on the math and coding part.
I liked the interactive environment. I disliked the short time that was given to calculus and the lack of contact with most of the lecturers.
I like the initiative and the TAs. But the material was not suitable for those at a lower level in math. It must be organized from lower to higher.

I liked the diversity of both participants and instructors and the multidisciplinary nature of topics and discussions. The course was satisfactory as an introduction to the field, and its environment was very friendly and indiscriminative, which is highly appreciated! What I found quite hard to cope with is the very long hours, especially with materials relatively foreign to individuals with a long biology background, and being in a subgroup with participants all from an engineering/CS backgrounds was also kind of challenging.
I appreciated the collaborative method in teaching. First 2 days of the course (Python) were overwhelming. 6 hours a day is intense.

I liked everything except the short time given for the big material.
Liked: Simplifying the complexity world of neuroinformatics. Disliked: Hectic days, for instance, the collapsed content as calculus that was introduced in one day!

Honestly, there is great effort in this course. It is very strong and beneficial. The workload is somehow high, especially if there are undergraduates like me. Due to my final exam schedule, I couldn't attend Biostatistics day. But generally, the course is very professional.
